intro: Mascagnia tenuifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mascagnia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals, and are produced in clusters along the stems. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky soils.
